DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this long-term study is to determine whether Zinc Acetate is effective and safe in the treatment of Wilson's disease among Japanese.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety, Long-term Study of Zinc Acetate to Treat Wilson's Disease in Japan.
DOC.detailed_description: Wilson disease is an autosomal recessive disorder with copper metabolism. In Japan, the standard treatment is the use of copper chelating agents, such as D-penicillamine and trientine. In this study, we investigate efficacy on zinc acetate in Japanese patients with Wilson disease.
DOC.criteria: Wilson's disease(adult, infant, pregnant woman) Acute hepatitis Malignant tumor
